column4: I am trying to get this tool compiled from source on ubuntu http://www.slac.stanford.edu/~abh/bbcp/ any help would be appreciated. I have installed the build essentials package and it appears the problem may be with the makefile.  Source here : http://www.slac.stanford.edu/~abh/bbcp/bbcp.tgz Thanks!
I've tried converting the rpms available on that site using alien to avoid building from source but still a no go
Can you give me a pastebin of you output you get when you try to compile?
Because it causes problems with dependencies, package name conflicts.... all kinds of stuff like that
You're probably just missing a -dev package or something.
make: *** No rule to make target `Linuxunknown'.  Stop.
What command are you using to make?
Okay, I looked at the makefile again, and  I see that the default make calls another makefile, so it got called differently than I thought....
Open the make file and find "Linux:"
Or alternatively, copy the makeLinuxi386 section to another labeled makeLinuxunknown
Ill run the make command you gave me again
